series.title: Terry Pratchett's Discworld: The Illustrated Screenplays
Discworld Stage Adaptations
series.description:
Stage adaptations of 15 Discworld novels have been published. The adaptations are by Stephen Briggs (apart from Lords and Ladies by Irana Brown), and were first produced by the Studio Theatre Club in Abingdon, Oxfordshire. They include adaptations of The Truth, Maskerade, Mort, Wyrd Sisters and Guards! Guards! Stage adaptations of Discworld novels have been performed on every continent in the world, including Antarctica.
    A stage version of Eric, adapted for the stage by Scott Harrison and Lee Harris, was produced and performed by The Dreaming Theatre Company.

series.title: The Long Earth
series.description: Collaborative science fiction series by Terry Pratchett and Stephen Baxter.

series.title: Discworld - Industrial Revolution
series.description:
See also: - Discworld Companion Books - Discworld Maps - The Science of Discworld Sub-series:
  • Discworld - DEATH Series
  • Discworld - Ankh-Morpork City Watch series
  • Discworld - Witches Series
  • Discworld - Rincewind series
  • Discworld - Tiffany Aching series
Discworld - Industrial Revolution series "The Sea and the Little Fishes" is a Discworld novella that can be found in Legends. It can also be found in Terry Pratchett's own collection, Once More, with Footnotes. This collection also includes the Discworld stories "Turntables of the Night", "Troll Bridge", and "Death and What Comes Next". "Theatre of Cruelty" is a short story that can be found in The Wizards of Odd. As of 2012, all Discworld shorter writings to date have now been published together for the first time as part of the collection A Blink of the Screen. It also collects a further Discworld short story, "A Collegiate Casting-Out of Devilish Devices", which had not previously been anthologised. Each book in the series is a self-contained story, with the exception of "The Colour of Magic" and "The Light Fantastic", which follow on directly and are best enjoyed when read together. However, most of the individual stories contain references to other characters and events within the series. While the books can be read and enjoyed in any order, reading them in publication order allows for a better appreciation of this ongoing continuity. Here is a Reading Order Guide: https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/62/41/b9/6241b98e13e6be139a7f2f20a3d105d6.jpg

series.title: Faeries
series.description:
(en français)
    
    Faeries est une revue trimestrielle consacrée exclusivement à la fantasy, sous toutes ses formes.
    
    Dans chaque numéro, on trouve des nouvelles francophones et étrangères. Un dossier principal consacré à un auteur incontournable de la fantasy. Quelques petits dossiers dédiés à des illustrateurs, des auteurs peu connus en France... Des chroniques de livres, de bandes dessinées et de jeux vidéo...

series.title: Discworld Stage Adaptations
series.description:
Stage adaptations of 15 Discworld novels have been published. The adaptations are by Stephen Briggs (apart from Lords and Ladies by Irana Brown), and were first produced by the Studio Theatre Club in Abingdon, Oxfordshire. They include adaptations of The Truth, Maskerade, Mort, Wyrd Sisters and Guards! Guards! Stage adaptations of Discworld novels have been performed on every continent in the world, including Antarctica.
    A stage version of Eric, adapted for the stage by Scott Harrison and Lee Harris, was produced and performed by The Dreaming Theatre Company.

series.title: Faeries
series.description:
(en français)
    
    Faeries est une revue trimestrielle consacrée exclusivement à la fantasy, sous toutes ses formes.
    
    Dans chaque numéro, on trouve des nouvelles francophones et étrangères. Un dossier principal consacré à un auteur incontournable de la fantasy. Quelques petits dossiers dédiés à des illustrateurs, des auteurs peu connus en France... Des chroniques de livres, de bandes dessinées et de jeux vidéo...

series.title: Discworld Stage Adaptations
series.description:
Stage adaptations of 15 Discworld novels have been published. The adaptations are by Stephen Briggs (apart from Lords and Ladies by Irana Brown), and were first produced by the Studio Theatre Club in Abingdon, Oxfordshire. They include adaptations of The Truth, Maskerade, Mort, Wyrd Sisters and Guards! Guards! Stage adaptations of Discworld novels have been performed on every continent in the world, including Antarctica.
    A stage version of Eric, adapted for the stage by Scott Harrison and Lee Harris, was produced and performed by The Dreaming Theatre Company.

  • Discworld - Witches Series

Discworld - Industrial Revolution series "The Sea and the Little Fishes" is a Discworld novella that can be found in Legends. It can also be found in Terry Pratchett's own collection, Once More, with Footnotes. This collection also includes the Discworld stories "Turntables of the Night", "Troll Bridge", and "Death and What Comes Next". "Theatre of Cruelty" is a short story that can be found in The Wizards of Odd. As of 2012, all Discworld shorter writings to date have now been published together for the first time as part of the collection A Blink of the Screen. It also collects a further Discworld short story, "A Collegiate Casting-Out of Devilish Devices", which had not previously been anthologised. Each book in the series is a self-contained story, with the exception of "The Colour of Magic" and "The Light Fantastic", which follow on directly and are best enjoyed when read together. However, most of the individual stories contain references to other characters and events within the series. While the books can be read and enjoyed in any order, reading them in publication order allows for a better appreciation of this ongoing continuity. Here is a Reading Order Guide: https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/62/41/b9/6241b98e13e6be139a7f2f20a3d105d6.jpg

    Faeries est une revue trimestrielle consacrée exclusivement à la fantasy, sous toutes ses formes.
    
    Dans chaque numéro, on trouve des nouvelles francophones et étrangères. Un dossier principal consacré à un auteur incontournable de la fantasy. Quelques petits dossiers dédiés à des illustrateurs, des auteurs peu connus en France... Des chroniques de livres, de bandes dessinées et de jeux vidéo...

series.title: Discworld
series.description:
See also: - Discworld Companion Books - Discworld Maps - The Science of Discworld Sub-series:
  • Discworld - DEATH Series
  • Discworld - Ankh-Morpork City Watch series
  • Discworld - Witches Series
  • Discworld - Rincewind series
  • Discworld - Tiffany Aching series
Discworld - Industrial Revolution series "The Sea and the Little Fishes" is a Discworld novella that can be found in Legends. It can also be found in Terry Pratchett's own collection, Once More, with Footnotes. This collection also includes the Discworld stories "Turntables of the Night", "Troll Bridge", and "Death and What Comes Next". "Theatre of Cruelty" is a short story that can be found in The Wizards of Odd. As of 2012, all Discworld shorter writings to date have now been published together for the first time as part of the collection A Blink of the Screen. It also collects a further Discworld short story, "A Collegiate Casting-Out of Devilish Devices", which had not previously been anthologised. Each book in the series is a self-contained story, with the exception of "The Colour of Magic" and "The Light Fantastic", which follow on directly and are best enjoyed when read together. However, most of the individual stories contain references to other characters and events within the series. While the books can be read and enjoyed in any order, reading them in publication order allows for a better appreciation of this ongoing continuity. Here is a Reading Order Guide: https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/62/41/b9/6241b98e13e6be139a7f2f20a3d105d6.jpg
series.note: Although it is popular among Discworld fans to divide the series into sub-"series" based on the main characters of each novel, these divisions are unofficial and often inaccurate. Discworld is one large series with a continuity that runs between all books.

Discworld - Industrial Revolution series "The Sea and the Little Fishes" is a Discworld novella that can be found in Legends. It can also be found in Terry Pratchett's own collection, Once More, with Footnotes. This collection also includes the Discworld stories "Turntables of the Night", "Troll Bridge", and "Death and What Comes Next". "Theatre of Cruelty" is a short story that can be found in The Wizards of Odd. As of 2012, all Discworld shorter writings to date have now been published together for the first time as part of the collection A Blink of the Screen. It also collects a further Discworld short story, "A Collegiate Casting-Out of Devilish Devices", which had not previously been anthologised. Each book in the series is a self-contained story, with the exception of "The Colour of Magic" and "The Light Fantastic", which follow on directly and are best enjoyed when read together. However, most of the individual stories contain references to other characters and events within the series. While the books can be read and enjoyed in any order, reading them in publication order allows for a better appreciation of this ongoing continuity.
